children.value: Let's draw together on city walls all over the world!
We decided to adapt our installation so we can exhibit with you during lockdown.
from your window with your neigboors to tackle monotony!
We exhibit every Sunday evening at 9PM. The installation works all over the world.
Would you like to join us next Sunday? Take out your video projector and fill this form:
Everyone can draw on its phone. The drawings appear instantaneously on the walls! Drawings travel between locations connecting people and creating a
. To videoproject from your home it's very simple: fill the form and we will contact you:
Sunday 19th April: Join the movement all over the world!

properties.title: The team
properties.style: width:100%;height:100%;margin:0;vertical-align:middle;position:absolute;top:0;left:0;

children.value: MAXIME TOUROUTE is a Visual Arts engineer

Graduated Artist from the School Polytechnique Universitaire de Nice (France), he pecializes in the fields of audiovisual and digital art.
He's developping projects combining interactivity, technology with a special focus on our relationship to intimacy. His

project exploring the technique of timelapses for human portraits gives him visibility with the #humanlapse reused by many photographers on social medias around the globe. His engineering education shapes his creative process with Space Dances, choregraphic explorations in Augmented Reality and The Live Drawing Project, collective drawing installation.
MAXIME HURDEQUINT is an Architect and Illustrator

frontmatter.title: Draw From The Window
frontmatter.subtitle: Decentralised Installation
frontmatter.description: Decentralised Installation The Live Drawing Project during the 2020 lockdown
